tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE network_traffic_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    source_ip VARCHAR(255),
    destination_ip VARCHAR(255),
    protocol VARCHAR(50),
    status_code INT
);

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_logs (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    source_ip VARCHAR(255),
    destination_ip VARCHAR(255),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    message TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE security_breaches (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    log_id INT,
    breach_type VARCHAR(50),
    description TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (log_id) REFERENCES network_traffic_logs(id)
);

CREATE TABLE network_logs (
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    source_ip VARCHAR,
    destination_ip VARCHAR,
    port INT,
    protocol VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE security_events (
    event_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    event_description VARCHAR,
    severity VARCHAR,
    source_ip VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE breach_detection (
    detection_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    source_ip VARCHAR,
    destination_ip VARCHAR,
    alert VARCHAR,
    action_taken VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    source_ip VARCHAR,
    destination_ip VARCHAR,
    protocol VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE security_breaches (
    breach_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    log_id INT,
    breach_type VARCHAR,
    description TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (log_id) REFERENCES network_traffic_logs(log_id)
);

CREATE TABLE user_activity (
    activity_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    activity_type VARCHAR,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_logs (
    log_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    source_ip VARCHAR,
    destination_ip VARCHAR,
    protocol VARCHAR,
    bytes_transferred BIGINT
)

CREATE TABLE potential_breaches (
    breach_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    log_id UUID REFERENCES network_traffic_logs(log_id),
    breach_type VARCHAR,
    breach_severity INT,
    detected_on TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE breach_details (
    detail_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    breach_id UUID REFERENCES potential_breaches(breach_id),
    detail_description TEXT,
    detected_by VARCHAR,
    action_taken VARCHAR
)

CREATE TABLE security_events (
    event_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    event_type VARCHAR,
    event_description TEXT,
    occurred_at TIMESTAMP,
    detected_by VARCHAR
)

CREATE TABLE security_admins (
    admin_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    admin_name VARCHAR,
    admin_email VARCHAR,
    admin_role VARCHAR
)
